docs.summary: This service is used by the trigger provider to report and cancel trigger event

relatedGuides.name: Internal: Creating a New Automations Trigger

params.name: triggerKey
params.doc:
Trigger key whose events you want to cancel.
 For example, `form_submitted` or `invoice_due`.

params.name: externalEntityIds
params.doc: Repeated list of external_entity_id, representing the related resources' IDs

docs.summary: Bulk cancels any remaining actions for a trigger and external entities.

params.name: triggerKey
params.doc:
Trigger key as defined in your app's trigger configuration
 in the Wix Developers Center.
 For example, `form_submitted` or `invoice_due`.

params.name: eventsInfo
params.doc: Repeated list of event details for bulk reporting

docs.summary: Bulk reports events and activates site automations with the specified trigger key.

params.name: externalEntityId
params.doc:
ID of the related resource in GUID format.
For example, `fc81a355-3429-50fc-a4c7-def486e828f3`.

Typically, this ID is defined in your system,
but you can also use any Wix resource GUID,
such as contact ID, member ID, or invoice ID.
See
[Choose the right `externalEntityId`](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-automations/triggered-events/reporting-and-canceling-events#wix-automations_triggered-events_reporting-and-canceling-events_choose-the-right-externalentityid)
for more information.

params.name: triggerKey
params.doc:
Trigger key whose event you want to cancel.
For example, `form_submitted` or `invoice_due`.

docs.summary:
Cancels any remaining actions for a trigger and external entity. Events are not cancelable by default. To make an event cancelable, you must first pass an `externalEntityId` and the applicable `triggerKey` to [Report Event](#report-event). When you call Cancel Event with the same `externalEntityId` and `triggerKey`, the event is canceled, as are all other events that share the `externalEntityId` and `triggerKey`. See [Reporting and Canceling Events](#reporting-and-canceling-events) for more information. > You cannot try out this endpoint because > it can be called only by the app that created the specified `triggerKey`. > So please ignore the **Try It Out** button.
__Permissions__ This endpoint requires the Manage Your App [permission scope](https://devforum.wix.com/en/article/available-permissions).

params.name: triggerKey
params.doc:
Trigger key as defined in your app's trigger configuration
in the Wix Developers Center.
For example, `form_submitted` or `invoice_due`.

params.name: payload
params.doc:
Event payload, formatted as key:value pairs.
Must comply with the payload schema
if you provided one when configuring your trigger.

Key names can include only alphanumeric characters or underscores
(`A-Z`, `a-z`, `0-9`, `_`).
They cannot start with an underscore.

Values can be strings, numbers, integers, booleans, or arrays.
If a value is an array, the array items must be objects,
and nested object properties must be
strings, numbers, integers, or booleans only.

params.name: externalEntityId
params.doc:
ID of the related resource in GUID format.
For example, `fc81a355-3429-50fc-a4c7-def486e828f3`.

Required if your app needs to
[cancel the event](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-automations/triggered-events/cancel-event)
if the automation becomes no longer relevant.

Typically, this ID is defined in your system,
but you can also use any Wix resource GUID,
such as contact ID, member ID, or invoice ID.
See
[Choose the right `externalEntityId`](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-automations/triggered-events/reporting-and-canceling-events#wix-automations_triggered-events_reporting-and-canceling-events_choose-the-right-externalentityid)
for more information.

docs.summary:
Reports an event and activates site automations with the specified trigger key. Only the app that created a trigger can report events for it. This means other apps can't report events for your triggers, and you can't report events for another app's triggers. If your app supports canceling events, `externalEntityId` must be provided. `externalEntityId` is required when calling [Cancel Event](#cancel-event). > You cannot try out this endpoint because > it can be called only by the app that created the specified `triggerKey`. > So please ignore the **Try It Out** button.
__Permissions__ This endpoint requires the Manage Your App [permission scope](https://devforum.wix.com/en/article/available-permissions).
activation status changed message

messages.name: _wix_automations_v2_ActivationStatusChangedDomainEvent
messages.displayName: Activation Status Changed Domain Event Object

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ActivationStatusChanged ID associated with this event.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc: Whether this event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (e.g., GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

messages.name: _wix_automations_v2_ActivationStatusChangedActionEvent
messages.displayName: Activation Status Changed Action Event Object

members.name: fieldKey
members.doc: the field key from the schema, for example "formId"

members.name: filterExpression
members.doc: filter expression that evaluates to a boolean, for example - {{ contains(["guid1","guid2"];formId) }}

members.name: preScheduledEventOffsetExpression
members.doc:
expression of offset before the trigger's time (in selected time unit), when the Automation should run
 only allows negative offset from the trigger's date (before the trigger), positive offset should be achieved via offset delay action
 preScheduledEventOffsetExpression: "{{5}}" + timeUnit: Days -  to run the Automation 5 days before the trigger's date
 or, preScheduledEventOffsetExpression: "{{ someNumberField }}" + timeUnit: Minutes, to run the Automation someNumberField's value in minutes before the trigger's date

members.name: scheduledEventOffsetTimeUnit
members.doc: Time unit for the scheduled event offset

members.name: filters
members.doc:
optional - list of filters on schema fields
 the relation between the filter expressions is an AND relation.
 all filter expressions must be evaluated to `true` for a given payload in order for the automation to be executed

members.name: scheduledEventOffset
members.doc: optional - future date trigger activation offset

members.name: inputMapping
skipConditionOrExpressionGroups
members.doc:
optional skip condition configuration - if this action should be skipped when the automation runs (following actions of a skipped action will still run)
 the action will be skipped if either of the expression groups evaluate to `true`
 the relation between the expression groups is an OR relation.

members.name: postActionIds
members.doc: actions to run in parallel after this action finishes

members.name: orExpressionGroups
members.doc:
the condition evaluates to `true` if either of the expression groups evaluate to `true`
 the relation between the expression groups is an OR relation.

members.name: truePostActionIds
members.doc: actions to run when the entire condition is evaluated to `true`

members.name: falsePostActionIds
members.doc: actions to run when the entire condition is evaluated to `false`

members.name: offsetExpression
members.doc:
optional - expression for amount of time to wait (in selected time unit) - from a specific date or from the time the action is executed
 offsetExpression: "{{5}}" + timeUnit: Days -  to wait for 5 days from the time the delay was invoked
 or, offsetExpression: "{{5}}" + timeUnit: Days + dueDateEpochExpression: "{{someDateField}}" -  to wait for 5 days from the time date in "someDateField" field in the payload
 or, offsetExpression: "{{ someNumberField }}" + timeUnit: Minutes,  to wait for someNumberField's value in minutes

members.name: dueDateEpochExpression
members.doc:
optional - expression of the due date to wait until, if an offset was defined, it will be calculated from this date
 number of milliseconds since the Unix Epoch (1 January, 1970 UTC)
 for example - "{{ 18238348023423 }}", or "{{ someEpochFromPayloadField }}" / "{{ contact.birthdate }}"

members.name: postActionIds
members.doc: actions to run in parallel after this action finishes

members.name: maxActivationsExpression
members.doc:
Maximum number of activations expression. the expression will need to be parsed to Int on runtime
 for example - "{{ 1 }}" to set max activations to 1, or "{{ var(someNumberField) }}" to set max activations as the value of "someNumberField" from the payload

members.name: rateLimitDurationExpression
members.doc:
Duration of the rate limiting window (in selected time unit) expression for rate limiter, if empty then no time limit. the expression will need to be parsed to Int on runtime
 for example - "{{ 10 }}" to set timeframe to be 10 minutes, or {{ var(someNumberField) }} to set timeframe in minutes as the value of "someNumberField" from the payload

members.name: rateLimitDurationTimeUnit
members.doc: Time unit for the rate limit duration

members.name: uniqueIdentifierExpression
members.doc:
Unique identifier of each activation by which rate limiter will count activations, expected return type is string
 for example - {{ var(contact.id) }} to set the unique identifier as the value of "contact.id" from the payload

members.name: postActionIds
members.doc: actions to run in parallel after this action finishes

members.name: booleanExpressions
members.doc:
list of boolean expressions to be evaluated with the given operator
 examples - {{ true }}, {{ someBooleanField }}, {{ contains(["guid1...","guid2..."];formId) }}

members.name: id
members.doc: Action id, if not specified, will be generated

members.name: namespace
spiInfo
members.doc: Spi Action (via RPC, HTTP or Velo)

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs. map of all actions by actionId
 The key is the actionId of the action, and the value is the action configuration

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

docs.summary: Automation runtime configuration

members.name: rootActionIds
members.doc: actions that run in parallel after the trigger

members.name: actions
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs. map of all actions by actionId
 The key is the actionId of the action, and the value is the action configuration

members.name: override
members.doc: is this a user modified preinstalled automation (on a specific site) or the original one

members.name: revision
members.doc:
*
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the Automation is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes,
the current revision must be passed when updating the Automation.

Ignored when creating an Automation.

members.name: createdBy
members.doc: information about the creator of the automation

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the Automation was created.

members.name: updatedBy
members.doc: information about who updated of the automation

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the Automation was last updated.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. Map of action id to action data.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: rootActionIds
members.doc: Ids of the first level actions.

members.name: actions
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Map of action id to action data.

members.name: inputMapping
members.doc:
Action's input mapping.
 Jsonata description of the input this service gets.

members.name: outputMapping
members.doc:
Action's output mapping.
 Jsonata description of the output this service returns.

members.name: appDefId
members.doc: The App Def Id of the action provider

members.name: actionKey
members.doc: Identifier for this action - human readable action key - unique per app def id

members.name: userActionConfig
members.doc: The configuration of the user for this action, can include params that are taken from the trigger event payload

members.name: postActions
members.doc: The post action to execute after this action

members.name: userOutputActionConfig
members.doc: The output configuration of the user for this action, can include params that are taken from the trigger event payload

members.name: skipConditionExpression
members.doc:
optional skip condition expression for current action
 decides whether to skip the action before executing it's post actions

members.name: conditionBlocks
members.doc: condition evaluates to `true` if either of the blocks evaluate to `true` (aka OR between all).

members.name: postActions
members.doc: Actions to perform when condition_blocks evaluates to `true`.

members.name: elsePostActions
members.doc: Actions to perform when condition_blocks evaluates to `false`.

members.name: dateExpression
members.doc:
jsonata expression - sleep until the given date
for example: $toMillis(MyObject.Date) + 2*1000*60*60*24) -> will schedule 2 days after MyObject.Date

members.name: delayExpression
members.doc: Optional, used if provided: Jsonata expression that evaluates to a number of milliseconds to wait

members.name: scheduleIdentifier
members.doc: jsonata expression, for example: triggerName + eventId

members.name: delay
members.doc: decide how long we should wait

members.name: overrideable
members.doc:
Optional: if true, any new schedule with the same schedule identifier will override the existing one.
 If false, the new schedule will be ignored.

members.name: maxNumOfActivations
members.doc: The maximum number of activations allowed in the given time frame

members.name: maxNumOfActivationsExpression
members.doc: Optional, used if provided: A jsonata expression that evaluates to the maximum number of activations allowed in the given time frame

members.name: timeFrameInMinutes
members.doc: If given - the time frame in minutes, otherwise, for life

members.name: timeFrameInMinutesExpression
members.doc: Optional, used if provided - A jsonata expression that evaluates to the time frame in minutes, otherwise, for life

members.name: keyJsonata
members.doc: The jsonata to use to extract the entity/resource key from the enriched event payload

members.name: postActions
members.doc: The actions to perform if this rate limiting action succeeded - meaning we are still in the allowed number of activations in the given time frame

members.name: postActionsIds
members.doc: The ids of actions to perform if this rate limiting action succeeded - meaning we are still in the allowed number of activations in the given time frame

members.name: automation
members.doc: Automation V2. Used for reporting domain event until activation request will be deprecated.

members.name: totalSuccesses
members.doc: Number of items that were successfully processed.

members.name: totalFailures
members.doc: Number of items that couldn't be processed.

members.name: undetailedFailures
members.doc: Number of failures without details because detailed failure threshold was exceeded.

members.name: id
members.doc: Item ID. Should always be available, unless it's impossible (for example, when failing to create an item).

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: success
members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

members.name: error
members.doc: Details about the error in case of failure.

members.name: externalEntityId
members.doc: Optional - external entity id that this activation is related to

members.name: externalEntityId
members.doc: Optional - external entity id that this activation is related to

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
 This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
 We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
 Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
 Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
 This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
 Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
 (for example, GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
 For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
  it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
 As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
 To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
  message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: key
members.doc:
A unique identifier for the event.
If you send the same idempotency key in multiple report event requests, for the same trigger key and app id,
consecutive requests will be ignored after the first one. Note that the idempotency key is kept for a week before it expires.

members.name: ttlInMilliseconds
members.doc: Optional. The time to live (TTL) in milliseconds before the key will expire. Default is a week.

members.name: triggerKey
members.doc:
Trigger key as defined in your app's trigger configuration
in the Wix Developers Center.
For example, `form_submitted` or `invoice_due`.

members.name: payload
members.doc:
Event payload, formatted as key:value pairs.
Must comply with the payload schema
if you provided one when configuring your trigger.

Key names can include only alphanumeric characters or underscores
(`A-Z`, `a-z`, `0-9`, `_`).
They cannot start with an underscore.

Values can be strings, numbers, integers, booleans, or arrays.
If a value is an array, the array items must be objects,
and nested object properties must be
strings, numbers, integers, or booleans only.

members.name: externalEntityId
members.doc:
ID of the related resource in GUID format.
For example, `fc81a355-3429-50fc-a4c7-def486e828f3`.

Required if your app needs to
[cancel the event](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-automations/triggered-events/cancel-event)
if the automation becomes no longer relevant.

Typically, this ID is defined in your system,
but you can also use any Wix resource GUID,
such as contact ID, member ID, or invoice ID.
See
[Choose the right `externalEntityId`](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-automations/triggered-events/reporting-and-canceling-events#wix-automations_triggered-events_reporting-and-canceling-events_choose-the-right-externalentityid)
for more information.

Trigger key as defined in your app's trigger configuration
 in the Wix Developers Center.
 For example, `form_submitted` or `invoice_due`.

ID of the related resource in GUID format.

Typically, this ID is defined in your system,
but you can also use any Wix resource GUID,

for more information.

For example, `form_submitted` or `invoice_due`.

members.doc: Optional: an activation id to link this action to

Change event created date
 TODO: deprecate

docs.summary:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • MINUTES
  • HOURS
  • DAYS
  • WEEKS
  • MONTHS
  • SECONDS

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_OPERATOR
  • OR
  • AND

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_ACTION_TYPE - Automation will be triggered according to the trigger configuration
  • SPI - Spi Action
  • CONDITION - Condition Action
  • DELAY - Delay Action
  • RATE_LIMIT - RateLimit Action

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_STATUS - unused
  • ACTIVE - Automation will be triggered according to the trigger configuration
  • INACTIVE - Automation will not be triggered

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_ORIGIN - default value. this is unused
  • USER - user created automation
  • RECIPE - automation created from recipe
  • APPLICATION - automation created by application (site specific)
  • PREINSTALLED - preinstalled application automation

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • OR
  • AND

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • MINUTES
  • HOURS
  • DAYS

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_TARGET
  • SCHEDULE
  • IMMEDIATE

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_CANCELLATION_REASON
  • EVENT_CANCELLED - Indicating that the activation was cancelled directly
  • AUTOMATION_DEACTIVATED - Indicating that the activation is cancelled because the automation was deactivated
  • AUTOMATION_DELETED - Indicating that the activation is cancelled because the automation was deleted

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_STATUS
  • INITIATED - This indicates activation is not started yet (no action has run yet)
  • SCHEDULED - The activation is in scheduled status when the automation has future date or debounce defined and we're in the waiting stage (no action has run yet)
  • STARTED - This indicates the automation activation has started and currently in progress
  • ENDED - This indicates all the automation actions were handled either by invoking them, skipping them etc.
  • CANCELLED - This indicates the activation was cancelled
  • FAILED - This indicates the activation failed to start Note that failure in the activation of a single action will not result a failure in activation of the entire automation
